meanings.definition: To gradually reduce the strength or effectiveness of something.
meanings.sent1: The constant arguing was attriting their friendship.
meanings.sent2: The harsh weather attrited the paint on the old house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel attrited the patience of the gardener by stealing all the nuts.
meanings.sent4: Time attrites our memories like waves smoothing out rocks on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tasks attrited her enthusiasm, leaving her feeling drained.

meanings.definition: To wear down or erode through constant friction or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The river attrited the rocks over centuries, shaping the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The rough sandpaper attrited the surface of the wood, making it smooth.
meanings.sent3: The cat attrited the sofa by scratching it daily.
meanings.sent4: The relentless wind attrited the sandstone cliffs, creating intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive motion attrited the gears, causing the machine to malfunction.
